comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: LoC has some photos of a J.H. Hammond home, (2221 Kalorama, now the residence of the French ambassador) but I'm not convinced it's the same building. www.loc.gov/pictures/search/?q=j.h.%20hammond%20home&...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: However, it does seem likely that the J.H. Hammond is John Hays Hammond, en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Hays_Hammond who was frequently in the news. His son, John Hays Hammond, Jr. [ en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Hays_Hammond,_Jr. ] who was experimenting with wireless control of unmanned boats, also made the news, but looks to have been based in Gloucester, MA at this time.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: According to www.tiltonbernstein.com/properties/lebourget/history.pdf 2221 Kalorama was built in 1910 for another mining magnate, William W. Lawrence. "In 1910, the largest house in Sheridan-Kalorama was constructed. Designed by Jules Henri De Sibour, 2221 Kalorama Road was built for mining magnate William W. Lawrence in the Jacobean Revival style. It was later owned by another mining magnate, John Hays Hammond, who sold it to the French government in 1936 for use as an Embassy..." So it may be that this picture is of a house Hammond lived in before he moved to 2221 Kalorama. users.starpower.net/oshel/latrobe.html refers to 2221 Kalorama as "the William Watson Lawrence house, now the French Embassy, at 2221 Kalorama Road, N.W." William Watson Lawrence died in 1916. See, for example, books.google.com/books?id=NRgUAAAAYAAJ&pg=PA95&lp... More likely that this is a different house.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See also In comments on that picture RockCreek (definitely an expert on DC buildings) reckoned this might be 1500 Rhode Island Avenue. www.loc.gov/pictures/item/ggb2004006120/ a Bain photo not yet uploaded, was clearly taken at the same house.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: In April 1913, they lived at 2315 Massachusetts Avenue, according to The Washington herald., April 29, 1913, Page 5, midway down 2nd column chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045433/1913-04-29/ed-... By January 1916, a Mrs. Francois B. Moran lived at 2315 Massachusetts Avenue. See The Washington times., January 01, 1916, HOME EDITION, Page 7 (box near top center) chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1916-01-01/ed-...
